intro: Papaver alpinum subvar. fallacinum, commonly known as the Alpine poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features striking, bright red or orange petals that are often tinged with yellow, forming a delicate, cup-shaped flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with smooth, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and subalpine habitats. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
